p: According to the CDC, primate mammals are the main “tanks” of the virus, while human-to-human (mosquito-borne) transmission occurs during the viral outbreak. This means that an infected mosquito, can infect a second mosquito not only directly but also through the blood of a human: the first infected mosquito bites the human, transmits the virus, and then a second healthy mosquito bites the same human and gets the virus through the blood. The cycle starts when a mosquito bites an infected person. After a 10 day incubation period, the mosquito’s saliva becomes infected and from that moment a mosquito becomes a vector able to infect a human [ 13].
